description.p: Moving at unnatural speed, a human bobs and weaves around the battlefield as an ogre moves to cut her off. In a blink she phases through the ogre, her eyes narrowing as she focuses on its warlock master trying to take refuge behind cover. She smirks as she strikes the air in front of her, but instead of her blade striking the air it strikes the flank of the warlock.

A dwarf drops down from the top of the mausoleum as a priest runs, by pursued by a wraith. Whirling his axes, he strikes the wraith and signals his allies. Arrows fly, plunging into the wraith as if it were made of flesh and bone.

Standing before a halfling is the armor-clad champion of the dragon cult. With but a thought, a blade of pure mental energy forms from the halfling’s fist and in that moment the fight begins. Landing a singular striking, the halfling smirks as he releases psionic energy that stagger’s his opponent.

Uniting all psychic warriors is a discipline forged from hammering its will to its purpose. Whether a spirit hunter or an exemplar athlete, each psychic warrior leverages maintained powers to amplify training.

Many warriors make a study of the martial disciplines of arms, armor, and tactics, but some warriors opt to delve into esoteric studies to reach states of altered consciousness and bend matter to their will. Psychic warriors are such students, becoming adepts to psychically enhancing their physical performance.

Controlling the forces of the spiritual and the mental is not a fast or simple task. Rather it is one that requires immense levels of focus and discipline. Psychic warriors frequently practice their psionic and martial arts with zeal matched only by the most consummate knights and dedicated fighters. For psychic warriors, it is imperative to have focused minds that seamlessly operate with vigorous movement.

Many psychic warriors recognize that simply studying or sequestering themselves away in cloisters will do little to push them in enhancing their powers. As such, they often seek to become adventurers to hone their skills and shape their minds into fine weapons

When creating your psychic warrior, consider what drove your character to merge martial training with psionic discipline. Was there an event in your past where you felt powerless with the tools available which compelled you to pursue more mystical means? Are you a polymath of martial feats that needed a further edge or challenge?

As a psychic warrior, you are able to support your group with talents similar to fighters and psions. You can readily fill roles like a fighter or paladin, but can also opt to focus yourself to be more like a rogue. While you won’t gain your Eclectic Attunement until 3rd level, you want to consider what choice you wish to make when deciding skills and how to prioritize your abilities as well as which powers are best suited for you. If you see your character as an armored defender you’ll probably choose powers that are defensive and give you more battlefield control. For a character that rapidly strikes enemies you’ll want movement or ranged powers. A ranged psychic warrior or an assassin themed one would choose different powers.

You can make a psychic warrior quickly by following these suggestions. First, Strength or Dexterity should be your highest ability score depending on whether you want finesse weapons or not, followed by Wisdom. Second choose the soldier background. Third choose speed of thought as your known power.
As an psychic warrior, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d10 per psychic warrior level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per psychic warrior level after 1st
Armor: Light armor, medium armor, heavy armor, shields
Skills: Choose two from Acrobatics, Athletics, Esoteric, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, and Stealth

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) scale mail or (b) studded leather and 2 handaxes
(a) a martial weapon and a shield or (b) two martial weapons
(a) a dungeoneer’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack

description.p: Prerequisites: Strength 13 or Dexterity 13 and Wisdom 13
Proficiencies: Light armor, medium armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons

setters.set: A warrior that augments combat prowess with psychic powers.
Light armor, medium armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons

description.p: At 1st level, you have can harness your psychic aptitude to manifest psionic powers.
You know one power of your choice from the psychic warrior power list.

The Powers Known column of the Psychic Warrior table shows when you learn more psychic warrior powers of your choice. Unlike spell casting classes, you may not replace powers when you gain levels in this class.

The Psychic Warrior table shows how many power points you have to augment your psychic warrior powers. When you manifest a power, you can expend power points to enhance your power. You can expend a number of power points no greater than half your psychic warrior level on a single power. You regain all expended power points when you finish a short or long rest.

Psionic powers differ from spells in that powers can have different expressions when augmented by power points. These different expressions have a similar theme, but the scope and scale can change. For example, the suspension power includes expressions that can affect single targets or an area with different measures of control.
Wisdom is your manifesting ability for your powers.

You use Wisdom whenever a power refers to your manifesting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a psychic warrior power you manifest and when making an attack roll.
Power save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Power attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

sheet.description: You have a pool of {{psionic-power:points}} to expend on psionic powers. You can expend up to {{level:psychic warrior:half}} points on a single power manifestation.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, when you have the psionic focus condition you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Each melee weapon attack deals 1d4 psychic damage. Starting at 9th level, this damage improves to 1d6. At 17th level, this damage improves to 1d8.
You gain advantage on saving throws against charm, compulsion, and fear effects.
Once per turn, you make Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration with advantage.

sheet.description: When you have the psionic focus condition, your melee attacks deal an extra 1d{{martial-focus:die-type}} damage, you gain advantage on saving throws against charm, compulsion, and fear effects, and, once per turn, you make Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration with advantage.

description.p: Psychic warriors have many abilities in common and draw from the same pool of powers to enhance their prowess. However, different warriors take on separate mantles that sculpt their relationship with the psychic forces they derive their powers from. Your Eclectic Attunement encapsulates this relationship, granting you thematic features.

Upon reaching 3rd level, you choose an attunement which expands your combat prowess by channeling your psychic powers in different ways: Ghost Hunter, Nomad, or Soul Knife, all detailed at the end of the class description. Your attunement choice grants you features at 3rd level, and then again at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Upon reaching 7th level, through rigorous discipline and exercise, you can move concentration on your currently maintained power to your unconscious mind, freeing you to maintain a second power. You can only maintain psionic powers through this feature. Any spell you cast, except a cantrip, will end each maintained power.
Any disruption in concentration will cause you to lose all maintained powers.
You may only use your Second Mind feature to maintain powers with a range of self (such as energy storm) or that you target specifically on you (such as inertial barrier).

sheet.description: You can move concentration on your currently maintained power to your unconscious mind, freeing you to maintain a second power. You can only maintain psionic powers through this feature. You may only use your Second Mind feature to maintain powers with a range of self or that you target specifically on you. Any disruption in concentration will cause you to lose all maintained powers.

description.p: At 7th level, you gain proficiency with Wisdom saving throws.

Upon reaching 11th level, when you use your action to manifest a power, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action. If you are maintaining a power that allows you to use your action to reactivate the power, you can also make one weapon attack as a bonus action just as if you manifested a new power.

sheet.description: Yhen you use your action to manifest a power, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action. If you are maintaining a power that allows you to use your action to reactivate the power, you can also make one weapon attack as a bonus action just as if you manifested a new power.

description.p: At 13th level, when making a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration from taking damage, the DC never exceeds 20. Additionally, powers you maintain through your Second Mind or Third Mind features can be maintained for up to two rounds if you are incapacitated. In this event, if you are no longer incapacitated before the powers expire, you can choose to continue to maintain the powers.

sheet.description: When making a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration from taking damage, the DC never exceeds 20. Additionally, powers you maintain through your Second Mind or Third Mind features can be maintained for up to two rounds if you are incapacitated. In this event, if you are no longer incapacitated before the powers expire, you can choose to continue to maintain the powers.

description.p: When you reach 15th level, your Second Mind ability improves to allow you to maintain an additional psionic power via a second unconscious mind. You can only maintain psionic powers through this feature. If you cast a spell other than a cantrip, all maintained powers will immediately end.
Any disruption in concentration will cause you to lose all maintained powers.
You may only use your Third Mind feature to maintain powers with a range of self (such as energy storm) or that you target specifically on you (such as inertial barrier).

sheet.description: You can maintain a third power following the same rules as Second Mind.

description.p: At 20th level, if you have no power points remaining when you roll initiative, you regain 2 power points.

sheet.description: If you have no power points remaining when you roll initiative, you regain 2 power points.

description.p: Ghost hunters are individuals who stalk the supernatural, often as part of a deep-rooted vendetta. They seek out and destroy ghosts, disembodied spirits, and incorporeal undead. They are restless pursuers of spirits and undead creatures, leaning toward unhealthy obsession in their drive to obliterate the creatures. Ghost hunters will spend time tracking their quarry and setting up a trap to destroy it. Their attitudes often brush others the wrong way, and most ghost hunters are loners by nature.

Many ghost hunters suffered tragedy at the hand of supernatural forces, driving them on their crusade against spiritual undead and similar fiends. The past of the typical ghost hunter is often tragic, and depression hovers over the hunter like early morning fog to a swamp.

As a ghost hunter, you can summon psychic energy that allows you to shroud your melee weapons with psychic energy. Twice per rest you can take a bonus action to empower any melee weapon (or unarmed attack) you possess for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom bonus (minimum of 1). This grants the weapon the following features so long as it remains in your possession:

ul.li: You are able to strike any creature you can perceive in the Ethereal Plane as if it were in your current plane of existence.
If the weapon is nonmagical, it counts as a magical weapon for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance and immunity.
Once per turn when you strike a creature you can mark it with ghostly light. A creature so affected is treated as if under the effect of faerie fire until the end of your next turn.

description.p: You gain additional uses of this ability when you reach 6th level (three times), 10th level (four times), and 14th level (five times). Completing a long rest will restore all uses.

sheet.description: You can take a bonus action to empower any melee weapon (or unarmed attack) you possess for {{ghost-touch:duration}} rounds. This grants the weapon: you can strike any creature you can perceive in the Ethereal Plane as if it were in your current plane of existence; it counts as a magical weapon for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance and immunity; once per turn when you strike a creature, it is under the effect of faerie fire until the end of your next turn.

description.p: At 3rd level when you take this attunement, you gain heightened defense against the spirits and dark forces you hunt. You gain proficiency with Charisma saving throws.
Possessing a strong sense of self in the face of formless horrors also confers upon you advantage on all saving throws made against charm and possession.

sheet.description: You have advantage on all saving throws made against charm and possession.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, when you hit a spirit with a weapon attack, power, or spell or when you hit a creature afflicted by the ghost light of your Ghost Touch feature, you force that creature to make a Wisdom saving throw against your power save DC. If the save is failed, the creature is paralyzed for 1 round per Wisdom modifier you possess (minimum 1 round). At the end of each of its turns the creature makes a new saving throw.

This ability ignores any immunity to paralysis an undead creature may possess. If an undead creature can’t be turned, or if the creature isn’t undead and is immune to the paralyzed condition it can’t be affected by this feature.
You may use this feature a three times per rest. You regain all uses after finishing a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When you hit a spirit with a weapon attack, power, or spell or when you hit a creature afflicted by the ghost light of your Ghost Touch feature, you force that creature to make a Wisdom saving throw against your power save DC. If the save is failed, the creature is paralyzed for {{ghost-touch:uses}} rounds. This ability ignores any immunity to paralysis an undead creature may possess. If an undead creature can’t be turned, or if the creature isn’t undead and is immune to the paralyzed condition it can’t be affected by this feature.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, any creature with the Incorporeal Existence, Incorporeal Movement, or Intangible traits or the ability to pass through matter, as well as a creature under the effect of gaseous form or similar effect, struck by your Ghost Touch feature is rendered tangible. Until the beginning of your next turn, the creature can no longer move through a creature, object, or surface, and it no longer has explicit damage resistance or immunity to non-magical attacks.

sheet.description: Any intangible or gaseous creature struck by your Ghost Touch feature is rendered tangible and it no longer has explicit damage resistance or immunity to non-magical attacks until the beginning of your next turn.

description.p: At 14th level, you can call upon your psychic resolve to smite an undead creature or a creature marked by your Ghost Touch feature a number of times equal to twice your Wisdom modifier (minimum one time). You can choose to invoke this power after hitting your target.

The creature takes an additional 2d6 radiant damage. If that target is undead and has 25 or fewer hit points after taking this damage, it must succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your power save DC or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature becomes frightened until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: You can smite an undead creature or a creature marked by your Ghost Touch feature a number of times equal to twice your Wisdom modifier (minimum one time). You can choose to invoke this power after hitting your target. The creature takes an additional 2d6 radiant damage. If that target is undead and has 25 or fewer hit points after taking this damage, it must succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your power save DC or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature becomes frightened until the end of your next turn.

description.p: At 18th level, once per long rest, when you would receive damage that would reduce you to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to regain hit points equal to half of your hit point maximum, but incur a level of exhaustion.

sheet.description: When you would receive damage that would reduce you to 0 hit points, you can regain hit points equal to half of your hit point maximum, but incur a level of exhaustion.

description.p: Tapping the very boundaries of material existence, nomads see themselves as disciples of esoteric martial tactics. Nomads pursue psychoportative powers to a greater degree than other psychic warriors, leveraging them to maneuver themselves or their attacks to the most advantageous points in combat.
At 3rd level, you can select one energy type from cold, fire, lightning, and thunder to channel.

Each energy power you manifest can deal this type of damage instead of its normal damage if you choose when you manifest the power. Powers that deal your Energy Type feature’s damage deal additional damage of the same type equal to your Wisdom modifier.
You add energy blast to your powers known. This power counts as a psychic warrior power for you, but doesn’t count against the number of psychic warrior powers you know.

sheet.description: Your energy powers to {{energy-type:string}} damage when manifested if you choose. Your powers also do an additional {{wisdom:modifier}} {{energy-type:string}} damage.

description.p: During your turn, when you hit a target with a melee or ranged weapon attack, you can take a bonus action to activate a burst of damage of the energy type you selected with your Energy Type feature. This burst deals damage equal to your Wisdom modifier of a type that matches your Energy Type feature.
You can use this burst of energy three times between rests. Completing a short or a long rest restores all uses of this feature.

sheet.description: When you hit a target with a melee or ranged weapon attack, you can activate a burst of {{energy-type:string}} that does {{wisdom:modifier}} damage.

description.p: At 6th level, you possess enhanced special awareness. Once per round, when a foe takes melee damage from another creature, you gain a +2 bonus on your first attack roll against that target. You may add your Wisdom bonus to the damage of this attack if it hits.

sheet.description: Once per round, when a foe takes melee damage from another creature, you gain a +2 bonus on your first attack roll against that target. You may add {{wisdom:modifier}} to the damage of this attack if it hits.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, you can take a bonus action to project the force of your melee attacks at enhanced range or cause missiles fired by your weapons to burst within an area. This effect lasts until the end of your current turn and counts as manifesting a power.
You may increase the range of each of your melee weapon attacks by 10 feet.
Your first ranged weapon attack will hit each target within a 10-foot square. You make only one attack roll and apply it each target’s AC.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom bonus (minimum once). After finishing a long rest, you regain all uses.

sheet.description: You can project the force of your melee attacks at enhanced range or cause missiles fired by your weapons to burst within an area. This effect lasts until the end of your current turn and counts as manifesting a power. You may increase the range of each of your melee weapon attacks by 10 feet. Your first ranged weapon attack will hit each target within a 10-foot square. You make only one attack roll and apply it each target’s AC.

description.p: When you reach 14th level, you gain advantage on saving throws against effects that deal the same damage as the damage type you selected with your Energy Type feature.

You also gain a psionic barrier that will absorb up to twice your psychic warrior level in damage from the same damage type. Every time you manifest a power or use a Nomad feature that requires your bonus action, you restore 5 hit points to this barrier. The barrier’s hit points can never exceed twice your psychic warrior level.

sheet.description: You gain advantage on saving throws against effects that deal {{energy-type:string}} damage.

description.p: Upon reaching 18th level, you can teleport yourself a distance of up to 120 feet away from your starting position as part of your Attack action. If you move less that the full distance traveled, with your bonus action, you can teleport any remaining distance so long as it is in the direction of your starting position, thus if you teleport 60 feet, you can teleport back to your starting position as a bonus action. Teleport destinations must be within your line of sight and into an unoccupied space.
Each attack you make after teleporting this way adds your Energy Burst feature’s bonus damage until the end of your current turn without consuming any of your uses of your Energy Burst feature.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom bonus (minimum once). You can recover one use by completing a short rest or all uses by completing a long rest.

sheet.description: You can teleport yourself a distance of up to 120 feet away from your starting position as part of your Attack action. If you move less that the full distance traveled, with your bonus action, you can teleport any remaining distance so long as it is in the direction of your starting position. Each attack you make after teleporting this way adds {{wisdom:modifier}} bonus {{energy-type:string}} damage until the end of your current turn without consuming any of your uses of your Energy Burst feature.

description.p: Soul knives believe in a purity of mind and see its manifestation as the most appropriate tool for violence. They can shape psionic energies into a blade shrouding their hands. Soul knives often serve as spies or assassins, able to travel discreetly since they don’t need to carry a weapon.
You gain the mind blade power and can manifest it as if interacting with an object.

At 5th level, you can make ranged attacks with your mind blade with a range of 50/200 feet. You can freely intersperse melee and ranged attacks as part of the same Attack action if you are manifesting a raw mind blade and not imbuing a normal weapon. Raw mind blade ranged attacks aren’t made with disadvantage if used within 5 feet of a hostile creature like a normal ranged attack would be.
Any feature that requires your mind blade, except those that explicitly indicate otherwise, can be used with a weapon imbued by your mind blade power.

sheet.description: You can manifest mind blade as if interacting with an object.

You can manifest mind blade as if interacting with an object. You can make ranged attacks with your mind blade with a range of 50/200 feet. You can freely intersperse melee and ranged attacks as part of the same Attack action if you are manifesting a raw mind blade and not imbuing a normal weapon. Any feature that requires your mind blade, except those that explicitly indicate otherwise, can be used with a weapon imbued by your mind blade power.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, when you hit a creature with an attack from your mind blade, you can expend 2 power points to deal 1d8 additional psychic damage to the target, in addition to the normal damage. You can expend a number of power points equal to half your psychic warrior level (to a maximum of 10 power points for a total of 5d8 damage)

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with an attack from your mind blade, you can deal 1d8 additional psychic damage to the target, per 2 power points spent (up to 10), in addition to the normal damage.

description.p: Upon reaching 10th level, you can use your action to momentarily fragment your mind blade into a whip-like psychic instrument to make a special attack action. This action will strike each creature you choose within 10 feet of you (roll to hit each). It deals normal, mind blade damage. If you use an imbued weapon, its normal damage is not dealt, instead replaced with the raw mind blade damage.
You may use your Psychic Strike feature on each creature you hit.

sheet.description: You can strike each creature you choose within 10 feet of you (roll to hit each). It deals normal, mind blade damage. If you use an imbued weapon, its normal damage is not dealt, instead replaced with the raw mind blade damage. You may use your Psychic Strike feature on each creature you hit.

description.p: When you reach 14th level, each creature damaged by your Psychic Strike feature suffers disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma ability checks and saving throws until the beginning of your next turn.

sheet.description: Each creature damaged by your Psychic Strike feature suffers disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma ability checks and saving throws until the beginning of your next turn.

description.p: At 18th level, you can now use your Bladewind feature at range. You can send fragments of your mind blade to strike a 15-foot cube up to 120 feet from you. You can select which creatures in the area are attacked, and must make an attack roll for each.

sheet.description: You can send fragments of your mind blade to strike a 15-foot cube up to 120 feet from you. You can select which creatures in the area are attacked, and must make an attack roll for each.
